title: What insiders are predicting for the Red Sox in free agency this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox seen as favorites to re-sign third baseman Alex Bregman; contract projections suggest six years at $160–171 million.
Boston is among top contenders for Kyle Schwarber and Pete Alonso, key power hitters in MLB free agency.
Red Sox may seek top pitchers like Dylan Cease and Framber Valdez, with multi-year deals predicted to span up to seven years.

title: Review & setlist: John Legend was a legendary pro at MGM Fenway (and he knew it)
author: Marc Hirsh
bullets: John Legend performed at MGM Music Hall at Fenway on November 7, 2025, celebrating 20 years since his debut album.
The concert featured songs from his debut album 'Get Lifted' along with covers and hits from his career.
Legend's show included emotional and musical variety, highlighted by his gospel influences and audience interaction.

title: Jaylen Brown seemingly criticizes officiating again following Celtics’ loss to Magic
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown criticized officiating after the Celtics' 123-110 loss to the Orlando Magic on Friday.
Brown previously expressed dissatisfaction with refereeing following a controversial call in the Celtics' 105-103 loss to the Utah Jazz.
Despite criticisms, Brown was not fined for his comments regarding the officiating in the game against the Jazz.

title: 5 things to know about Buccaneers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Baker Mayfield leads the Buccaneers with a 6-2 record, despite a recent dip in MVP candidacy.
Rookie receiver Emeka Egbuka has 562 yards, five touchdowns but has struggled against man coverage.
Tampa Bay's defense ranks high in DVOA, led by standout performances from Vita Vea and Jamel Dean.

title: Patriots’ return to relevance includes appearance by Jim Nantz in TV booth to call game for CBS
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jim Nantz and Tony Romo will call the Patriots-Buccaneers game on CBS, the first time since 2023.
Nantz and Romo's assignment is seen as a sign of the Patriots' renewed relevance with Drake Maye and Mike Vrabel.
Nantz expressed excitement about calling his first Drake Maye game, noting their shared agent and past connection.

title: Magic pull away, beat Celtics despite another big Jaylen Brown game: 8 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: The Boston Celtics suffered a 123-110 loss to the Orlando Magic, despite Jaylen Brown scoring 32 points.
The Magic excelled from three-point range, making 17 of 36 attempts, while the Celtics struggled beyond the arc.
Payton Pritchard showed improvement in his shooting, hitting 5 of 8 three-pointers, finishing with 27 points.

title: Public reprimand recommended for judge accused of helping immigrant escape ICE
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Judge Shelley Joseph recommended for public reprimand for creating an appearance of impropriety in a 2018 incident.
Hearing officer Denis McInerney found Joseph did not authorize the escape of a defendant from ICE custody.
Federal charges against Joseph were dropped in 2022 after she agreed to state misconduct investigation.

title: Alex Cora still high on Red Sox’ future a month after being eliminated by Yankees
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox lost to Yankees 2-1 in AL Wild Card Series, ending their 2025 postseason run.
Manager Alex Cora expresses optimism for Red Sox future, despite roster uncertainties and offseason challenges.
Key roster changes include Trevor Story opting in, Alex Bregman opting out, and potential outfield trades.

title: Giant blade breaks off Mass. wind turbine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A wind turbine blade detached and fell into a cranberry bog in Plymouth, Massachusetts with no reported injuries.
The incident occurred at a turbine located near 810 Head of the Bay Road, triggering an automatic shutdown.
Officials secured the site, and the incident is under investigation by MassDEP and Inspectional Services.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'The Fantastic Four: First Steps' now streaming on Disney+ features Pedro Pascal and Vanessa Kirby in Marvel's newest MCU phase.
Guillermo del Toro's 'Frankenstein' showcases a unique version of Mary Shelley's novel, now available on Netflix.
'Materialists', starring Dakota Johnson and Pedro Pascal, offers a satirical take on romcoms, streaming on HBO Max.
